titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: ~~Wit & learning well used are like the golden earrings, & bracelets of the Israelites; abused, like the same gold cast into a molten idol, than which nothing more abominable. No such prey for the Devil, as a good wit unsanctified: great wits oft times mislead not only the owners, but many followers besides: as how many shall once wish they had been born dullards, when they shall find their wit & learning to have barred them out of heaven.~~

body.p: I finished a sermon; wrote a sheaf of letters: prepared Ethel White, another of the students, for Baptism, attended Evensong in St Margaret's: & so frittered away the day. Ella was taken to the play by her aunt; & thus I had the evening to myself.
